result.execSummary:
The defendant Zedrick Heade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zedrick Heade is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zedrick Heade was found guilty of Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay a $450.00 fine inclusive of all applicable court costs and surcharges by 06-20-17 or, if not paid, 20 days in jail.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Defendant's report date is 07-05-16

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Siefert, Br 47, for review.  jm

Defendant Zedrick Heade in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.  Defendant's report date is 7/5/2016.
Court order defendant provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered defendant to pay $450.00 inclusive of all applicable court costs and surcharges by 6/20/2017 or, if not paid, 20 days in jail.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral Form and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Defendant Zedrick Heade in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count ONE: 
 Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

On motion of the State, Court ordererd Count TWO:  Dismissed. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State filed motion in limine; witness list and proposed jury instructions.
Defendant Zedrick Heade in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case remains on for jury trial in branch 47.

Defendant Zedrick Heade in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Carl Knepel appeared under the student practice rules under the supervision of Katherine M Halopka-Ivery for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk Miranda Goodchild hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Jeffrey Krueger. Sworn for the State:  MPO Nicholas Lorum  State rests.  Defense does not present any witnesses.  Arguments heard.  Court placed findings on the record.  Court DENIED defense suppression motion.   Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zedrick Heade in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to adjourn is Granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 47.

Defendant Zedrick Heade in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 47  Motion hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the defense request for an adjournment.  Case adjourned to Branch 47.

Defendant did appear in court later in the morning and was given a slip with the next court date.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense filed motion to suppress. lr
Motion hearing scheduled for 09-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zedrick Heade in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zedrick Heade in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for a Pretrial Conference. Defense requests an adjourned Pretrial Conference. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zedrick Heade in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for continued  pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pandora E.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Zedrick Heade in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
